comment.author: 43688219@N00
comment._content: The Canadian National Library and Archive has only one likely match on their database for Canadian's who served in the Great War - a Lieutenant Charles Alvarez. Unfortunately no other details are recorded - not even a date of birth or place of enlistment. www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/databases/cef/001042-119.01-e... As far as I can tell the 32nd Battalion was a Reserve Unit and did not actually serve in a Theatre of War. There remains the possibility that he did actually serve with another unit but was nominally still on the establishment of the 32nd. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_infantry_battalions_in_the_... It would appear the division was based in the UK. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/195th_(City_of_Regina)_Battalion,_CEF en.wikipedia.org/wiki/152nd_(Weyburn-Estevan)_Battalion,_CEF cefresearch.ca/matrix/Army%20Corps/Divisions/Reorganized%...
